page.title: 13HEALTH
page.content: The West Linton Health Centre was built in 1982. The government provided the money. It is a very attractive building and has rooms for the doctors nurses,physiotherapist,chiropodist, baby clinic and the dentist. We have three doctors, two fully trained and one under training and two nurses who are here all the time. Local charities like the Kenny Paul Trust and the Whipman Play have donated money so that the doctors could buy a radio link system. This is useful as the doctors have a wide area to cover. Extra equipment that one would only find in a hospital has also been donated eg. nebulisers for asthmatics and chest patients. When patients need hospital treatment they are sent to hospitals in Edinburgh which is nearer than our own area hospital in Galashiels.
